channel.title: Binge!
channel.description: Welcome to Binge! The podcast that helps to curate your choices and make your downtime count!! Celebrity pals and busy parents Alex Jones and Harry Judd are on a mission to maximise your free time. By sourcing the best recommendations of what to watch, listen or read, they are finally putting an end to the endless searching that happens when you're trying to discover something new! Each week Alex and Harry call upon celebrity friends, colleagues and listeners to discover the best shows for every occasion as well as sharing some great behind the scenes stories from some of your best loved shows.

channel.content:encoded:
Welcome to Binge! The podcast that helps to curate your choices and make your downtime count!!

Celebrity pals and busy parents Alex Jones and Harry Judd are on a mission to maximise your free time. By sourcing the best recommendations of what to watch, listen or read, they are finally putting an end to the endless searching that happens when you're trying to discover something new!

Each week Alex and Harry call upon celebrity friends, colleagues and listeners to discover the best shows for every occasion as well as sharing some great behind the scenes stories from some of your best loved shows.

item.title: Which Celebrity House did Alex & Harry SNOOP Around? Plus, Dating Advice from guest Elizabeth Day
item.description:
Which Celebrity House did Alex & Harry SNOOP Around? Plus, Dating Advice from guest Elizabeth Day
Alex Jones and Harry Judd are back with more binge-worthy recommendations! This week, they’re joined by novelist and creator of the hit podcast ‘How To Fail’, Elizabeth Day. She chats about her new dating podcast, ‘How To Date’, and she reveals her top dating app picks. Alex shares her review of Sonic 3, and Harry and Alex spill the details on the celebrity home they both visited for a house viewing!
Timecodes: 00:50 - Celebrity House Viewing 04:53 - TV Recommendations - The Morning Show & Conclave 08:55 - Sonic 3 (perfect half term viewing!) 10:05 - Boyzone Documentary 14:51 - Elizabeth's New Podcast 22:47 - The Traitors 31:16 - Reality TV Recommendations 34:30 - Desert Island Binge
TV & Film
The Morning Show (Apple TV)
The Apprentice – (Apple TV)
Conclave (Apple TV)
The Traitors (BBC iPlayer)
Sonic 3 (Cinema)
Boyzone Documentary (Sky & NOW TV, from 2nd February)
Boybands Forever (BBC iPlayer)
Love Island: All Stars (ITV)
The Real Housewives (Bravo) – Best franchises: Beverly Hills, Atlanta, Salt Lake City, New York
Veep (NOW TV)
Podcasts
How to Fail – Podcast by Elizabeth Day
How to Date – Podcast by Elizabeth Day & Mel Schilling
The Archers (BBC Radio 4)
Books The complete works of Charles Dickens

item.title: What’s Making Women Leave Their Husbands? Alex Reviews a Shocking Book! Plus, guest Jenni Falconer
item.description:
Alex Jones and Harry Judd are back with more great binge-worthy recommendations, but this time with apps and kids birthday party ideas too! RunPod host Jenni Falconer joins the conversation, and finally convinces Alex to give Yellowstone a go. Harry reveals the new show that has dethroned Mr Inbetween as his ultimate favourite. And Jenni tells us why The Curious Case of Benjamin Button is a must-see show in the West End!
Listen to Jenni’s RunPod with Harry Judd as a guest, here
Timecodes: 00:44 - Natural History Museum Sleepover! 04:05 - Treating Head Lice 05:36 - Harry’s Marathon Training 08:23 - TV Show Recommendations: American Primeval 13:12 - Dark Comedy: Breeders 17:14 - Guest: Jenni Falconer 25:05 - Theatre Recommendations 33:30 - Desert Island Binge: TV, Podcast, and Book Recommendations

Theatre The Curious Case of Benjamin Button Choir of Man

item.title: SAS Rogue Heroes or Don't Die? Plus, Emilia Fox on Silent Witness' new home!
item.description:
Alex Jones and Harry Judd are back sifting through the masses of content, from SAS Rogue Heroes to Don’t Die: The Man Who Wants to Live Forever, deciding whether they're binge-worthy or bin-worthy! Special guest, Emilia Fox gives us the inside scoop on 20 years of Silent Witness, including where their new home is! Plus, Alex shares her post-Christmas recycling struggles, while Harry shares his surprising skincare routine!
Timecodes: 0:08 – SAS Rogue Heroes & Don’t Die: The Man Who Wants to Live Forever. 2:33 – Alex’s Post-Christmas Recycling Struggles 8:23 – Harry’s New Skincare Routine 13:31 – Special Guest: Emilia Fox talks Silent Witness, acting, and BAFTA picks. 20:57 – Emilia’s Recommendations: Films, TV series, and podcasts to binge.
Recommendations:
SAS Rogue Heroes (BBC iPlayer)
Don’t Die: The Man Who Wants to Live Forever (Netflix)
Day of the Jackal (Sky)
A Night at the Museum (2006 film)
Emelia Perez – An award-winning film about a Mexican cartel leader.
Conclave – About the election of a new pope, based on Robert Harris's novel.
The Apprentice (Film) – A deep dive into Donald Trump’s early years and rise to power.
The Rest is Politics (podcast) – hosted by Alastair Campbell and Rory Stewart.
The Reith Lectures (BBC Sounds)
Sherlock Holmes series & Agatha Christie’s Mysteries (Books)

item.title: What’s The Show You Were DEFINITELY Too Young To Watch?… 👀
item.description:
In today’s episode, Harry and Alex dive into your top recommendations and questions! You’ve been recommending current gems like The Traitors and SAS Rogue Heroes and heartfelt series like Virgin River and Breeders. PLUS they chat about the films and tv shows growing up you were (supposedly) too young to watch… 👀
Recommendations

item.title: Is This Why The Traitors is So Addictive? - Plus Angela Scanlon SLAMS Wicked!
item.description:
Alex and Harry chat with Angela Scanlon, TV Presenter and host of BBC Two’s Your Home Made Perfect. They discuss what makes BBC One’s hit show The Traitors so watchable and Angela tells Harry what she REALLY thinks about Wicked. Plus, discover the unusual place all the McFly Boys have matching Tattoos… 🫣
Listen to Angela Scanlon on Virgin Radio UK every weekend from 7-10am!

item.description:
Joining Alex & Harry today is actor Jonno Davies, who portrays Robbie Williams in the upcoming biopic Better Man, hitting cinemas this Boxing Day! item.title: Abi Morgan’s EXCLUSIVE 'Bridget Jones' NEWS!
item.description:
This week on BINGE!, Alex and Harry sit down with award-winning writer Abi Morgan, known for The Split, Eric, The Hour, and The Iron Lady. Abi reveals her favorite TV shows, films, and books, spanning from heartfelt rom-coms to intense espionage dramas. Plus, get the inside scoop on her book ‘This is Not a Pity Memoir’ being adapted into a blockbuster movie and an exclusive behind-the-scenes glimpse into the brand-new Bridget Jones film. Don’t miss it!
Recommendations:
The Split Barcelona - BBC One (29th & 30th December) Bridget Jones 4 (Cinemas Valentine’s Day) The Last Journey - (Amazon Prime, Apple TV) After the Party - (Channel 4) The Hour - (Netflix) Black Doves (Netflix) The Agency (Paramount) Somebody Somewhere (HBO) Normal People (Hulu/BBC iPlayer) White Lotus (HBO) We Live in Time (Cinemas)

item.title: McFly's 'Better Man' SECRET! Plus Michael Ball "The Love Island House STANK!"
item.description:
Harry Judd and Alex Jones are back, this time with their reviews of the upcoming Robbie Williams biopic 'Better Man', with Harry dropping an absolute bombshell revelation! Joining them for this episode is singing superstar, Michael Ball. Find out how Michael ended up on the set of Love Island during a family holiday, why he's so obsessed with Game of Thrones that he's watched it 3 times! And his ultimate podcast of choice; it's a gem!
Harry and Alex also share their thoughts on Blitz (Apple+) and The Penguin (Sky Atlantic)
You can find Michael's Book 'Backstage Betrayal' and get tickets for his tour here: https://michaelball.co.uk
Recommendations: Better Man (Cinemas, from Boxing Day) Elizabeth R. item.content:encoded:
Harry Judd and Alex Jones are back, this time with their reviews of the upcoming Robbie Williams biopic 'Better Man', with Harry dropping an absolute bombshell revelation! Joining them for this episode is singing superstar, Michael Ball. Find out how Michael ended up on the set of Love Island during a family holiday, why he's so obsessed with Game of Thrones that he's watched it 3 times! And his ultimate podcast of choice; it's a gem!


Harry and Alex also share their thoughts on Blitz (Apple+) and The Penguin (Sky Atlantic)


You can find Michael's Book 'Backstage Betrayal' and get tickets for his tour here: https://michaelball.co.uk


Recommendations:

Better Man (Cinemas, from Boxing Day)

Elizabeth R. (BBC iPlayer)

House (Prime Video)

Tales of the Unexpected (BritBox)

Married at First Sight (Australian version) 

Love Island (ITVX)

Dear Joan and Jerica (Podcast)

Game of Thrones (Max, Prime Video)

House of the Dragon (Max)

The Penguin (Sky Atlantic)

Blitz (Apple+)


We want to hear from YOU! Send us a message or voice note on WhatsApp: 07418 627194 or email us: hello@bingepodcastofficial.com

item.title: Can the Third Movie in a Franchise EVER Be the Best?
item.description:
Welcome to the Bingees Extra Bit! This is an episode dedicated to your comments, questions, and recommendations. In this episode, Alex Jones and Harry Judd are inspired by the debate over whether a third movie in a franchise can outshine its predecessors, exploring classics like Indiana Jones, Toy Story 3, and Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban. Listener shoutouts include everything from Gangs of London on Netflix to the Before Trilogy starring Ethan Hawke and Julie Delpy, plus a festive nod to Netflix's new Christmas hit, Hot Frosty.
The duo also discuss the gripping drama Curfew on Paramount+ and there’s a listener review in for Gladiator 2.
Find out what’s binge-worthy or bin-worthy as they give us an espresso shot of joy!
We want to hear from YOU! Send us a message or voice note on WhatsApp: 07418 627194 or email us: hello@bingepodcastofficial.com

item.title: Giovanna Fletcher’s I’m a Celeb Favourite & Harry’s Emotional Wicked Review!
item.description:
Alex Jones and Harry Judd are back with the stuff they’ve been watching this week. They’ve done the homework so you don’t have to, sifting and sorting the binge-worthy from the bin-worthy. In this episode the extent of Harry’s obsession for ‘Wicked’ is revealed, and he shed’s light on Mcfly’s bizarre post gig ritual… Plus Giovanna Fletcher joins, sharing stories from her incredible journey trekking the Himalayas for breast cancer awareness, raising £1.5M for charity, balancing life as an actress, author, and podcaster, and starring in the UK tour of The Girl on the Train.
Find out more about CoppaFeel Treks: https://coppatrek-himalayas.coppafeel.org/.
Recommendations:
Wicked (Cinemas)
Joan (ITVX)
The Split (IPlayer)
Until I Kill You (ITVX)
Bird Box (Netflix)
The Girl on the Train (Play)
Eve of Man (Book)

item.title: Did You Spot Daniel Craig in Heartbeat? Plus, Is Gentle Murder a Genre?
item.description:
In this episode of the 'Bingees Extra Bit', Alex Jones and Harry Judd go through your questions, listener recommendations, and a cozy stroll down memory lane with nostalgic TV shows and classic films. From “gentle murder shows” like Midsomer Murders and Murder She Wrote to awkward TV moments you wouldn’t dare watch with family (Industry, anyone?).
Alex and Harry also debate whether Dirty Dancing is still a classic, and how you say Mammia Mia - are you Team Alex or Team Harry?

item.title: Pandora Sykes Talks RIVALS, Trump Drama, and the Book Breaking Up Marriages!
item.description:
Alex Jones and Harry Judd chat with special guest Pandora Sykes, journalist, author, and host of Rivals: The Official Podcast. A former columnist and editor at The Sunday Times Style, she has published two books (The Sunday Times best-selling essay collection, How Do We Know We're Doing It Right? and What Writers Read: 35 Writers On Their Favourite Book) and created numerous No.1 podcasts and she runs a popular bi-weekly culture Substack, Books+Bits.
Books, TV, and Podcast Recommendations:
Books: Frankie by Graham Norton, All Fours by Miranda July, and This Is Not a Pity Memoir by Abi Morgan.
TV Shows: Rivals, The Crown, Brassic, and The Apprentice (biopic on Donald Trump).
Podcast: Rivals The Official Podcast and The Kill List (Wondery)
We want to hear from YOU! Send us a message or voice note on WhatsApp: 07418 627194 or email us: hello@bingepodcastofficial.com

item.description:
Welcome to the 'Bingees Extra Bit' as Alex Jones and Harry Judd take your recommendations and share the latest updates from their lives! Harry talks about McFly's 21st anniversary special airing on ITV on Saturday 9th November at 5:30pm. Plus, we get musical with Mean Girls, share podcast recommendations with 'He Said She Said' and drama on Netflix with Lover Stalker Killer. And, we finally answer the big question: Is a crawdad a bird or a crayfish?
We want to hear from YOU! Send us a message or voice note on WhatsApp: 07418 627194 or email us: hello@bingepodcastofficial.com

item.title: The Must-Watch Horror Film That'll Haunt You! With TikTok Star Eccy Reviews
item.description:
It's our Halloween special as Alex Jones & Harry Judd enter the spine-chilling world of horror films with TikTok sensation Eccy Reviews. Alex and Harry swap Halloween prep stories, share their own ghostly encounters, and put their horror knowledge to the test with Eccy’s help.
Key Recommendations:
The Blair Witch Project
The Sixth Sense
A Quiet Place
It Follows
Long Legs featuring Nicolas Cage
Woman of the Hour - starring Anna Kendrick
Jeepers Creepers

item.title: Who Was Michelle Keegan’s Teenage Obsession? This Will Shock You!
item.description:
Join Alex Jones and Harry Judd as they share some of your favourite picks from Our Welsh Chapel Dream to Claudia Winkleman’s book Quite. Plus, Harry reveals the TV show he's just been asked to do, and Michelle Keegan's secret obsession!
Recommendations: Welsh Chapel Dream – a heartwarming renovation show with community spirit, featuring Keith from The Great Pottery Throw Down. Quite – a book by Claudia Winkleman. Fool Me Once – a gripping thriller by Harlan Coben.

item.title: DISCLAIMER! This Episode Gets Spicy! Plus, Beverley Knight’s True Crime Obsession!'
item.description:
Alex Jones and Harry Judd chat all things binge-worthy with special guest Beverly Knight! They discuss what makes a show 'spicy', why some shows are best watched without your parents, and why Beverley's streaming homepage is filled with true crime and period dramas.
Recommendations:
Harry’s Picks:
Nobody Wants This – Netflix
Industry – BBC iPlayer
Alex’s Picks:
Rivals – Disney+
Disclaimer – Apple TV+ (with Cate Blanchett)
Beverley's Picks:
Menendez Brothers: Monsters – Netflix
American Murder: The Family Next Door – Netflix
Downton Abbey – ITV/Netflix
The Godfather – Film

item.title: Christmas Movies in October?! Too Soon or Just Right?
item.description:
Alex and Harry react to your picks and add a few shows to their own binge lists with the Bingees! Extra Bit. Our episode dedicated to YOU!
Bingees! Recommendations:
• Death in Paradise (BBC): A British detective solves murders on a beautiful Caribbean island.
• Lonesome Dove (Amazon): Two retired Texas Rangers embark on a perilous cattle drive, facing adventure and friendship across the American West.
• The Notebook (Apple TV, Prime Video) : A heartfelt romance follows Noah and Allie, whose love endures despite societal challenges and years apart.
• Normal People (BBC): An intimate look at the complex relationship between two Irish teens, Connell and Marianne, as they grow up and evolve.
• Under The Bridge (Disney+): A gripping true-crime documentary exploring the murder of Canadian teen Rina Virk and its lasting impact on her community.
• 911 (Disney+): An action-packed drama following LA first responders as they tackle emergencies and navigate their personal lives.

item.title: EXCLUSIVE REVIEW: Super/Man - The New Christopher Reeve Story & Taskmaster's Alex Horne!
item.description:
Alex Jones and Harry Judd are joined by Alex Horne, the mastermind behind Taskmaster! Alex shares behind-the-scenes stories about the show, and gives us the inside scoop on his brand-new project! Plus, they talk about what he’s watching and loving right now!
Alex and Harry also trade embarrassing stories about awkward moments, and they share the best content they're enjoying to keep your watchlist full for the week ahead.
Key Recommendations:
Industry (BBC iPlayer)
Nobody Wants This (Netflix)
Super/Man - the Christopher Reeve Doc (In Cinemas from Nov, 1st)
Free Solo (Netflix)
The Dawn Wall (Netflix)

item.title: Game of Thrones Red Wedding Reaction & "It's Bomer!"
item.description:
Alex and Harry react to your picks and add a few shows to their own binge lists with the Bingees! Extra Bit. Our episode dedicated to YOU!
Bingees! Recommendations:
The Bear (Disney+): A gripping drama about a chef keeping his brother's memory alive through his restaurant.
Umbrella Academy (Netflix): A quirky superhero show that’s loved by many but debated by Harry!
Queen of Villains (Netflix): A wild, chaotic brawl of a series about a kind girl-turned-pro wrestler.
Vogue Through the 90s (Disney+): A stylish docuseries about fashion in the 90s told by Vogue editors.
Miracle in Cell No. 7 (Netflix): A tearjerking true story about a father’s fight to prove his innocence.
The Haunting of Hill House (Netflix): A chilling horror series that’s not for the faint-hearted.
Fellow Travelers (Showtime): A forbidden love story with electrifying chemistry.
A Gentleman in Moscow (Paramount+): A period drama that's been praised for its beautiful setting.
Lessons in Chemistry (Apple TV+)

item.title: LOVE ISLAND Creator Jo Scarrett-Jones on The Untold SECRETS of Reality TV!
item.description:
Alex and Harry help you separate the binge-worthy from the bin-worthy with TV producer Jo Scarratt-Jones. Jo, the creator of Love Island and a launch producer for I’m A Celebrity Get Me Out of Here, also brought us Eat Well For Less and produced Alex’s special, Making Babies. Discover how Jo played a key role in sparking the romance between Peter Andre and Katie Price, hear her insights on the rise of reality TV, and get her top recommendations for hidden gems you need to watch!
Key Recommendations:
Kin – A gritty Irish drama focussed on a family's criminal activities, feuds. Available on BBC iPlayer.
Emily in Paris – Light-hearted escapism filled with fashion, stunning locations, and a sprinkle of drama. Stream it on Netflix.
Nyad – An inspirational film about a 64-year-old swimmer's open-water challenge, featuring Annette Bening and Jodie Foster. Catch it on Netflix.
Binge! is a Viral Tribe Entertainment Production

item.title: THE BEAR OR BEEF? David O'Doherty & Max Rushden's Hilarious TV Mix-Up & Naked Attraction SHOCK!
item.description:
Alex Jones & Harry Judd are joined by broadcaster Max Rushden and comedian David O'Doherty from their hit podcast 'What Did You Do Yesterday?'. Max and David share their TV recommendations from Death in Paradise to Narcos; Naked Attraction to Curb Your Enthusiasm, but do Alex & Harry think their choices are binge-worthy or bin-worthy!?
TV Show Recommendations:
Death in Paradise
White Lotus
Ludwig
Narcos
The Bear
Slow Horses
Curb Your Enthusiasm
Faulty Towers
Gentleman in Moscow
We want to hear from YOU! Send us a voice note on WhatsApp: 07418 627194 or email us: hello@bingepodcastofficial.com

item.title: Is SLOW HORSES Worth the Hype?
item.description:
Alex and Harry share their top picks (and ones to ditch!) to help you skip the endless faff of finding something, so you can enjoy your free time! In this episode, Alex talks about watching Snack vs Chef (Netflix) and reading This Is Not a Pity Memoir by Abi Morgan. Meanwhile, Harry has been watching Slow Horses (Apple TV); an Emmy-winning drama about MI5 misfits, starring Gary Oldman and Jack Lowden.
Binge-Worthy or Bin-Worthy? Harry: Still re-watching Breaking Bad (Netflix) and binging Slow Horses (Apple TV) Alex: Trying Harry’s recommendation of Mr. Inbetween (Disney+)
Homework: Alex's Homework: Listener Hannah recommends Alex watches America's Sweethearts: Dallas Cowboys Cheerleaders (Netflix) - A modern-day Dance Moms meets America's Next Top Model. Harry's Homework: More Slow Horses (Apple TV).
Send us a voice note on WhatsApp with your recommendations or questions: 07418 627194 or email us: hello@bingepodcastofficial.com

item.title: Is Succession Overrated? And Will Ferrell’s Must-Watch Doc!
item.description:
Harry and Alex chat about their weekly watchlist to help you sort through the overwhelming amount of content out there. Harry's raving about series 2 of Colin from Accounts (BBC iPlayer), a hilarious Australian comedy where love and chaos bloom after a nipple-flashing accident, while Alex has been gripped by a touching new Will Ferrell documentary, Will & Harper (Netflix). Plus, they debate Succession (Sky) – is it binge-worthy or overrated? And don’t miss Alex's tale with Tom Jones and Harry's dad's feedback on the first episode!
Binge-Worthy:
Will & Harper (Netflix)
Strictly Come Dancing (BBC iPlayer)
Beef (Netflix)
Bin-Worthy: Eric (Netflix)
Homework: For Alex: Watch Mr. Inbetween (Disney+) For Harry: Watch Slow Horses (Apple TV+) – listener Emily's recommendation. Forfeit: Watch Sharknado (Amazon Prime) as punishment for incomplete homework!
Want to share your recommendations, email: hello@bingepodcastofficial.com

item.title: Is Colin From Accounts the Funniest Show on TV Right Now?
item.description:
Welcome to Binge! Your go-to podcast for entertainment recommendations, hosted by Alex Jones and Harry Judd. Tired of endless scrolling? Alex and Harry are here to help you find your next binge-worthy obsession! You'll get recommendations for podcasts, books, films and TV to help make your precious downtime count!
In this episode, Alex and Harry chat about Love Is Blind, The Perfect Couple, New Amsterdam (Netflix), and their latest comedy obsession, Colin From Accounts (BBC iPlayer). Plus, they debate over Breaking Bad, which - can you believe it? - is already 16 years old!
Special guest Emma Judd (Harry’s mum!) joins the chat, sharing her pick of the week, Freddie Flintoff's Field of Dreams (BBC iPlayer).
Alex’s Homework for Harry: Watch Mr. Inbetween (Disney+), at least 4 episodes! Harry’s Homework for Alex: Finish Colin from Accounts Series 2 (BBC iPlayer)
Share your recommendations, email: hello@bingepodcastofficial.com

item.title: Trailer - Launches 12th September!
item.description:
Welcome to Binge! The new podcast designed to curate your choices and make your downtime count!!
Celebrity pals and busy parents Alex Jones and Harry Judd are on a mission to maximise your free time. By sourcing the best recommendations of what to watch, listen or read, they are finally putting an end to the needless faff and endless scrolling that occurs when trying to discover something new, or as we call it – binge anxiety!
Each week Alex and Harry call upon celebrity friends, colleagues and listeners to discover the best shows for every occasion as well as sharing some great behind the scenes stories from some of your best loved shows.
Follow us on Instagram @bingepodcastofficial
Email: hello@bingepodcastofficial.com
Binge! is a Viral Tribe Production
